docs.text: Welcome to My Homepage! Hi, I'm Viktor Bengs. I'm a data scientist at the Research Group Artificial Intelligence (FSKI) of state Hesse, Germany and a research scientist at the German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence (DFKI) . Before I was a Postdoc at the Chair of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, LMU Munich and the Munich Center for Machine Learning (MCML). My research focuses on the development of theoretically sound algorithms for sequential decision tasks with weakly supervised feedback, e.g., preference information or censored observations, with automated algorithm configuration and medicine being the main application areas. Additionally, I am also interested in studying fundamental properties for quantifying uncertainty as well as investigating research questions in cooperative game theory. Contact 📧 viktor.bengs@ifi.lmu.de 🐦 Twitter: @BengsViktor 🔗 Google Scholar
docs.title: Home

docs.text: Hi, I'm Viktor Bengs. I'm a data scientist at the Research Group Artificial Intelligence (FSKI) of state Hesse, Germany and a research scientist at the German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence (DFKI) . Before I was a Postdoc at the Chair of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, LMU Munich and the Munich Center for Machine Learning (MCML). My research focuses on the development of theoretically sound algorithms for sequential decision tasks with weakly supervised feedback, e.g., preference information or censored observations, with automated algorithm configuration and medicine being the main application areas. Additionally, I am also interested in studying fundamental properties for quantifying uncertainty as well as investigating research questions in cooperative game theory.

docs.text: Welcome to My Homepage! Hi, I'm Viktor Bengs. I'm a data scientist at the Research Group Artificial Intelligence (FSKI) of state Hesse, Germany and a research scientist at the German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence (DFKI) . Before I was a Postdoc at the Chair of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, LMU Munich and the Munich Center for Machine Learning (MCML) . My research focuses on the development of theoretically sound algorithms for sequential decision tasks with weakly supervised feedback, e.g., preference information or censored observations, with automated algorithm configuration and medicine being the main application area. Additionally, I am also interested in studying fundamental properties for quantifying uncertainty as well as investigating research questions in cooperative game theory. Contact 📧 viktor.bengs@ifi.lmu.de 🐦 Twitter: @BengsViktor 🔗 Google Scholar

docs.text: Hi, I'm Viktor Bengs. I'm a data scientist at the Research Group Artificial Intelligence (FSKI) of state Hesse, Germany and a research scientist at the German Research Center for Artificial Intelligence (DFKI) . Before I was a Postdoc at the Chair of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, LMU Munich and the Munich Center for Machine Learning (MCML) . My research focuses on the development of theoretically sound algorithms for sequential decision tasks with weakly supervised feedback, e.g., preference information or censored observations, with automated algorithm configuration and medicine being the main application area. Additionally, I am also interested in studying fundamental properties for quantifying uncertainty as well as investigating research questions in cooperative game theory.
